snippet.title: The Eames lounge chair: an icon of modern design
snippet.description: This book is the first in-depth study of one of the most revered pieces of American furniture, and its equally revered creators.

snippet.description: A noted furniture designer discusses functional and aesthetic elements of more than 40 "classic" modern chairs. Profusely illustrated with photographs and explanatory drawings.

snippet.title: Charles and Ray Eames
snippet.description: This engaging new series is dedicated to showcasing the very best in furniture and object design from some of the most important architects of the Twentieth-century.

snippet.title: The work of Charles and Ray Eames: a legacy of invention
snippet.description: The essays in this handsome and generously illustrated volume examine the Eameses' projects in the contexts of science, corporate patronage, and politics as well as those of modern design, architecture, and art.
